subject: oem_ibm: Reset Watchdog Timer
commitMessage:
oem_ibm: Reset Watchdog Timer

The watchdog timer is started as soon as the BMC
is powered on. Host sends GetTID to BMC, BMC
responds to that and sends SetEventReceiver
command with a specified time interval(Heartbeat). Host
is supposed to send PlatformEventMessage to BMC
within the elapsed interval.

We use the same infrastructure as that of surveillance
for implementing host watchdog. The difference between
surveillance and host watchdog is that-
-> Surveillance is host monitoring the BMC if it is
   functioning and its us up and running and if the BMC
   fails to respond to ping from host, then host will
   reset the BMC
-> Watchdog is BMC monitoring if the host boots without
   failures, and if host does not respond to pings from
   BMC after the watchdog interval, then the watchdog app
   triggers a host dump.

Watchdog monitoring is followed by surveillance.

This commit adds change to reset the watchdog
timer on receiving PlatformEventMessage for
heartbeat elapsed time from Host

Tester with pldmtool:
./pldmtool raw -d 0x80 0x02 0x0A 0x01 0x01 0x06 0x01 0x01
Request Message:
08 01 80 02 0a 01 01 06 01 01
Received Msg
08 01 80 02 0a 01 01 06 01 01
Sending Msg
00 02 0a 00 00
Received Msg
08 01 00 02 0a 00 00
Response Message:
08 01 00 02 0a 00 00

Signed-off-by: Sagar Srinivas <sagar.srinivas@ibm.com>
Change-Id: I9fea658c3f2d3086ad2574ef827a5154dac6960e

pldm:oem_ibm
Can we name this as a const expr instead of magic number ?(say HBterminusHandle )
platform event message
should remove the magic number and add a constant instead
Will other methods use this value?
Ack
false?
Ack
Nit: Could you add a blank line?
Done

instead of checking the tid, check Watchdog::checkIfWatchDogRunning() 
reset if it is running
can we make it public as well?

may be a brief description here that watchdog is started as soon as bmc is powered on. and Host is supposed to send a platformEventMessage periodically so that bmc resets the watchdog each time.
the handshake is established by sending the setEventReceiver beforehand
Done
Done
is this the trace that is in question? i guess we can omit this trace
Done
how is this different from surveillance ? you should explain if we are using the similar infrastructure for both .
Done
this should be in the surveillance commit where you added this. not in this commit.
Done
why was this removed ?
Done
why was this moved from its place ?
this was done to pass oemPlatformHandler into the base handler
why was this moved from its original place, was it intentional ?
this was done to pass oemPlatformHandler into the base handler
Logically the patch for surveillance should come last in the chain.
yes, that's right. But since the watchdog part is more OEM we wanted it to come later in the chain. Will it be blocking? because If I have to change the order the rework would take lot of effort :)
This should probably go as the last parameter
Done
@brief
Done
nit: "watchDogRunning" is descriptive enough.
Done
Add doxygen
Done
#ifdef is needed? oemPlatformHandler will be nullptr in the case of other machines?
Done
How is the watchdog enabled in the first place? How is the time configured for the watchdog?
The watchdog app is started by systemd when host is powered on. The time is configured through the watchdog app.
Should this go under OEM_IBM or you want to propose it as standard OEM?
This is a standard OEM, for non IBM implementations this pointer would be a nullptr.
